BOOK A CALL
Food Safety for Small Businesses

Food Safety is essential for your brand and provides you with incredible growth opportunities.

But, navigating the complex world of food safety can feel overwhelming, especially for entrepreneurs juggling multiple responsibilities.

With our help, it doesn’t have to feel stressful and time-consuming.

Acclivity Food Safety is here to help you establish a clear, manageable process so you can feel confident that your products are safe and that your food safety program supports the growth of your business.

WORK WITH ME
VIEW SERVICES
Aligning Food Safety With Your Goals

Building your CPG business with a strong food safety foundation puts you in a position for success and growth! 

I am committed to helping you achieve your wildest goals by providing food safety support tailored to your unique challenges and objectives. 

With 17 years of experience in quality assurance, food safety, and business improvement, I’ve successfully implemented and sustained a world-class food safety standard (BRCGS) for one of Canada’s first GFSI-certified breweries. My expertise in building and optimizing contract manufacturing programs, combined with first-hand experience navigating growth, change, and supply chain challenges, equips me with the tools and determination to ensure your success. 

You’re a small CPG business owner trying to grow your business

You’ve followed your dreams and become an entrepreneurship. you’ve already achieved so much! 

✓  You’ve found a processing location and you’re ready to move out of the home kitchen

✓ You have an amazing food or beverage product that you want to get into more retail locations

✓ You’ve been given the opportunity to become a co-packer or private label producer and diversify your revenue steams 

✓  Your goal is to sell your products on a international scale

✓ You are busy and the food safety program is falling behind

If any of these sound like you, Acclivity is here to help.

You don’t know what you don’t know…
Your business is amazing, but when it comes to food safety: 

You’ve read the Regulations and aren’t sure if your program is fully compliant or overkill. 

You’re gearing up for an audit but are not 100% sure you’re ready. I mean, you’re doing all the things so you’re good, right? 

You feel confident but can’t get that prerequisite program to stick. Why?!

You’ve been given a great opportunity and it time to enhance your food safety program, but you’re a little confuse or don’t have the time. 

If you’re unsure about food safety, you’re not alone! We’re here to support you.

WORK WITH ME

How Can I Help You?

Establishment: Building or Upgrading Your Food Safety Program

For newcomers and seasoned CPG companies alike, this is where we build a solid food safety program together. Let’s develop and implement a food safety program that meets requirements and suits your unique business. 

Customized Food Safety Services

For those who need help in a particular area or with a specific issue. Get targeted support for specific challenges where extra expertise is needed. Whether it's troubleshooting a specific issue or refining your process, I’m here to help with whatever issue you struggling with.

Fractional Food Safety Management (FFS)

If food safety were a song, it'd be the song that never ends. Are you struggling to keep up with the ongoing maintenance of your food safety program, but can't afford to hire someone full time? I got you!

Acclivity provides expert oversight and support for your food safety programs. FFS ensures your systems remain effective without the need for a full-time hire.

LEARN MORE
A food safety program is not a one and done project.

Whether you're just starting out or you're fully established, understanding how your food safety program works and how it can benefit everyone is key to a successful business. A proper food safety program is not a one-time project that leaves you with a cabinet full of binders filled with generic policies. It requires continuous attention, regular reviews and updates, and ongoing training and communication. 

That is why we work with CPG businesses to ensure you are equipped with an effective program that is embedded into your daily responsibilities. Together, we build an efficient food safety program that not only ensures product safety but also considers all the other important aspects of your business, such as productivity.

Your new biggest fan
Hey, I’m Liz - Your expert small business food safety consultant. 

Over the last 17 years working in the food and beverage industry, I have found deep satisfaction in contributing to any type of improvement. My career in food safety has awarded me the opportunity to do just that.

I’ve enjoyed working for both small and large companies, and have found that helping small companies is when I feel most fulfilled. 

I want you to feel 100% confident about the safety of your product, and I want you to be ready for any challenge or opportunity life throws at you. I believe in the importance of local and small businesses for our communities and a strong economy. I want you to be successful!

That’s why I’m passionate about improvement and finding purpose in problem-solving, investigating, and sharing what I’ve learned. 

Together, we can achieve your place on the shelf and beyond. I’m looking forward to working with you!

LEARN MORE ABOUT ME
Why Generic Food Safety Programs Fail—Even for Similar Categories

Your unique leadership, staff, suppliers, building, and equipment are great examples of why YOUR food safety program should be different than another businesses.  

Which is why I offer tailored solutions designed to fit YOUR site, YOUR team, and YOUR vision.

Whether you're a small business or a larger operation, our practical approach is focused on what works best for your team and your processes to ensure each batch is safe and consistent.

Acclivity’s services will bring your business value and peace of mind with flexible options that can be adapted to your goals.

If you're not sure what you need, don't hesitate to reach out—we’re here to help find the right solution for you!

Assessments
Implementation
Specialized Help
Fractional Food Safety
Supplier Audits
SEE ALL SERVICES

What People are saying

“As an effective Manager, Liz has demonstrated strong leadership skills that have helped gain the respect of her subordinates and peers. One of her strengths is communication as well as her abundant experience creating and writing policy and the accompanying documentation."

— Paul Gautreau, (former) VP Operations and Brewmaster

"Change Management of the magnitude that BRC brought to our doorstep doesn't come without significant communication, organization, and problem-solving. Liz is supremely capable in translating manufacturing process into written policy, peerless in attention to detail, and has a firm but friendly communication style that encouraged our employees to "come along for the ride"."

— Brad Goddard, VP of Business Development, Innovation, & Government Relations

Item 1 of 2
Let’s work together

Ready to Take Your Business to the Next Level With Food Safety? 

You’re going to love the feeling and benefits that a strong food safety program awards you and your brand! It’s time to start your food safety implementation or improvement journey without the stress and guesswork of trying to handle it alone.

 Get in touch today to schedule a free phone consultation! Together, we’ll create a plan that fits your needs and keeps your business running smoothly—so you can focus on what you do best. 

BOOK A FREE CONSULT
Let's be friends!

Sign up with your email address to receive occasional tips and updates. Don’t worry, I won’t spam you.

 SIGN UP

I respect your privacy

Empowering small businesses to build strong and sustainable food safety programs that let them thrive.

Grow with confidence

Food, Pet and Animal Nutrition Company
Pioneering Nutrition Solutions from Field to Product

With over 75 years of experience, we utilize our deep industry knowledge, market insights, and innovation expertise to create solutions for today and tomorrow.

Scroll to next section
Unlocking Nature Enriching Life

ADM is a global leader in both human and animal nutrition. We utilize the power and provisions of nature to create ingredients and solutions that generate safe, healthy, and sustainable nutrition for people and animals around the world.

ADM helps to bring nutritional solutions to those who need them. From our vast portfolio of ingredients that can satisfy tastes and fulfill nutritional needs to our ability to innovate full formula, consumer-relevant, science-based nutrition solutions proactively or through co-creation with customers. And through our years of involvement in the nutritional world, we have also created capabilities to sustainably manage and add value to every part of the global nutrition supply chain through operational proficiency with a worldwide footprint.

ABOUT ADM
LATEST NEWS
Our Solutions Tailored to Your Needs

ADM is committed to nourishing the quality of life for humans and animals. ADM has something nutritional to bring to the table for all.

Human Nutrition

With the power of nature, we transform natural products into ingredients and solutions that help bring delicious, nutritious, and exciting food and beverages to consumers worldwide.

DISCOVER MORE
Animal Nutrition

As a full solutions partner, we help to bring the best, customized solutions and services to support your animals' health and welfare for all stages of their growth.

DISCOVER MORE
Pet Nutrition

Our pet nutrition experts help you understand the opportunities and create innovative pet products consumers are looking for.

DISCOVER MORE
Industrial Biosolutions

With an increasing demand for sustainable and environmentally friendly solutions, ADM provides innovative solutions that maintain or even improve performance standards.

DISCOVER MORE
Services

DISCOVER MORE
Insights & Innovation

Partnering with ADM gives you access to our technical capabilities and experts, deep consumer insights, and global innovation problem solvers.

DISCOVER MORE
Nourishing Tomorrow's Innovations

Innovate smarter with ADM's expertise and cutting-edge nutrition solutions. 

Report: Elevated Snacking

Discover how ADM blends creativity, expertise, and a vast ingredient pantry to create health-promoting snacks that fit seamlessly into consumers' daily lives.

LEARN MORE
eBook: Science-backed Gummy Goodness

Stand out from the competition with ADM's expertly-crafted, health-focused gummy supplements that meet consumer demands for taste, wellness, and convenience.

GET STARTED
Case Study: Explore the Frontier of Color Emulsion Technology

Unlock ADM's vast portfolio of naturally-derived colors and patented emulsions to bring vibrancy and stability to your food and beverage products.

EXPLORE MORE
Shaping a Sustainable Future

Through our years as a global leader in nutrition, ADM is striving to reduce environmental impact and helping people, businesses, and our world thrive.

OUR ACHIEVEMENTS
22
Carbon Neutral Mills
We've achieved net carbon-neutral status for all of our U.S. wheat, sorghum, and corn flour milling operations.
75
Years of Experience
ADM brings over 75 years of experience in global nutrition innovation and problem-solving to every customer need.
06
Continents
We're focused on global nutrition with innovation centers, processing plants, and procurement centers on six continents.
Careers that Help You Change the World

Not every career offers you challenging, rewarding work that also improves lives across the globe. Whether it’s finding new opportunities for renewable products, developing the next flavor trend, or ensuring crops get to markets where they’re needed, the problems we solve make a real difference.

WE'RE HIRING

our gourmet buns

QUALITY INGREDIENTS FROM AROUND THE GLOBE​

Alvim's Fine Foods is a Calgary based company producing gluten-free, yeast-free, nut-free, gourmet cheese buns. This product is a great choice for those on selective diets or with food allergies and sensitivities. 

 

These bite sized hors d'oeuvres are made from cassava, a root vegetable native to Brazil. Cassava flour’s white color offers a neutral taste, and fine texture. Each bun is packed with 40% cheese, creating a truly delicious product.

about

ALVIM'S FINE FOODS

Alvim's Fine Foods is a locally owned and operated by Henrique Alvim.  Fueled with a passion for people and a penchant for entrepreneurship, Henrique takes pride in offering his customers clean, high-quality food products.

​

In 2012, he took his recipe to Toronto's "Next Great Food Product Contest" and won! He later attended the Restaurants Canada Show in Toronto and quickly learned that he had something special.  Building on that momentum, Alvim's Fine Foods was born.

​

Check out Alvim's in the media.

"These buns are a treat! They are so soft and gooey in the middle and each flavour is perfected. I love that they just happen to be gluten free too!"

-Darlene Warren

"I can't believe how easy and delicious these buns are. My entire family loves them and we always get comments from friends when we put them out or bring them as an appie."

-Philip Morin

BABA'S BLACK GARLIC IS...

Alberta Made
1
2
3
4
WHAT IS BLACK GARLIC?

Baba's Black Garlic is from California and processed completely in Alberta, Canada.

All Black Garlic is made from fresh whole garlic bulbs blackened to perfection utilizing the Maillard Reaction with carefully controlled heat and humidity.  Baba's distinctly soft and moist texture is perfect for mashing and mixing to a variety of food ingredients.

Black Garlic is gaining more popularity with chefs worldwide as an Umami flavour ingredient to add to their fine cuisine. 

BABA'S BAKED BLACK GARLIC CURRY CHICKEN THIGHS WITH WILD RICE

Never any leftovers when this hits the table. Baked to perfection in a yellow curry sauce with black garlic salted through out the sauce brings a new amazing flavour to any curry dish.

BABA'S BLACK GARLIC WOOD FIRED SLOW BAKED SALMON

Mr. Wilson loves treating his guests to Pacific Wild Salmon slow cooked on a cedar plank, using a Hickory wood pellet fired BBQ... The fillets are gently rubbed with Baba's Black Garlic infused Olive Oil, Pepper and fresh Lemon juice.

BABA'S BLACK GARLIC BBQ PORK ROAST

It's always BBQ season and we can never get enough of it. Kicking off this year with an amazing Black Garlic glaze to perfect this mouth watering pork roast.

BLACK GARLIC TERIYAKI CHICKEN

Ninja Jay treated his family to this delightfully marinated chicken thighs with Baba's Black Garlic, Teriyaki, Honey and slow roasted in a wood pellet oven and smoked with low heat for 150 minutes.  Dish is finished with Cilantro and Sesame Seed garnish.

BLACK GARLIC - CANADIAN MADE

Premium Ingredients for Pet Food Excellence.

Welcome to Big Sky Milling, your trusted partner for premium pet food ingredients. Located in the heart of Canada's pulse and specialty crops production in Alberta, Canada. We are committed to sourcing and producing nutrient-rich pulses, seeds, and specialty crops for the high-grade pet food industry.

Elevating Pet Nutrition with Premium Legumes

Discover our meticulously milled products crafted from the highest-quality, sustainably sourced ingredients in North America.

Our Products
Our Pillars of Excellence

At Big Sky Milling, we have a deep understanding of what discerning buyers in the pet food industry seek. Our premium beans and legumes form the bedrock of nutritious pet food, and we excel in three fundamental aspects:

Sustainably 
Quality 
Reliability
Customized Ingredient Milling for Pet Food Manufacturers

We are more than just ingredient suppliers; we are dedicated partners in the pet food industry. We understand the unique requirements of pet food manufacturers, and our state-of-the-art facilities are tailored to efficiently process these ingredients to your exact specifications. Whether you need ingredients in whole, ground, or blended formats, we have you covered. Our flexible packaging options, including bags, totes, and bulk, cater to your specific needs. 

Safety: Ensuring Industry-Grade Quality

Our commitment to quality and safety shines through our strict compliance with industry guidelines, safeguarding the integrity of our pet food ingredients from production to delivery.

The Power of Pulses for Pet Nutrition

In the quest for optimal pet nutrition, the choice of ingredients plays a pivotal role. Pulses, including peas, lentils, chickpeas, and beans, emerge as the frontrunners for discerning pet owners. Not only do these legumes offer functional processing attributes, antioxidant properties, and wide availability, but they also align with the growing consumer demand for sustainable pet food options. Consumers, increasingly mindful of their pets' health, seek plant-based protein alternatives, making pulses a natural and beneficial addition to pet food formulations.

This experience was extremely professional, personalized and made simple. I would recommend this service to any mom looking to save their stash and keep the freezer clear. The marketing materials with the personalized water measurements and information about my milk is so cool! I didn’t opt for the nutrient analysis based on my budget but that would be super cool, especially if freeze drying is in your benefits plan. Janna can provide an estimate and receipt for your insurance claim - under health spending, lactation services, nutritional services and maybe kinesiology.
natalie hawkins
December 18, 2024
Just do it! 100% worth it to extend the life of your breastmilk by freezedrying it. Janna is incredibly kind and I've received the absolute best customer service.
Jessica Anderson
November 29, 2024
To preface my experience, my breastfeeding journey with my first daughter was not nearly as plentiful as this second time around. With that, I’ve been a bit anxious sort of anticipating my supply to just plummet and so I wanted to explore my options for how else I can get breast milk into my daughter #2 ideally for the first 12 months. I came across Booby Food and was immediately intrigued. Not only do I now have my own freeze-dried breast milk that will stay good for 3-5 years, I now - to my husband’s delight - have room for frozen food in my freezer! The team at Booby Food completely went above and beyond and exceeded my expectations. Beginning with the online purchase + intake form, the process was simple, professional, and efficient. I was amazed at how streamline the receiving shipping cooler/packing of the milk/drop off at Fed Ex/delivery of freeze-dried product was. I was in awe of the packaging (never thought a box of breast milk would make my eyes water, but here we are…) and easy-to-follow directions upon receipt of dried milk (I also appreciate the included personalized nutritional info about my milk). The care and attention to detail from the Booby Food team is very apparent. It is clear the team are passionate about what they do day in and day out and truly want the - dare I say - best nutrition for your babe, for as along as possible. I am still breastfeeding so I have not yet needed to dip into my freeze-dried stash - although I’d like to dabble with making a diaper rash paste in the coming days for my little one. I extend a very heartfelt thank you to everyone involved in producing my freeze-dried milk stash, and of course thank you Janna, for starting such an incredible business in the first place for all us mamas to use. I’m not sure if we are still growing our family but if I have another baby, my path with Booby Food will cross again. If you have a freezer of breast milk and don’t think you’ll use it all up, I highly highly recommend considering taking advantage of Booby Food’s service.
Kelly Mares

Even More Benefits of Freeze-Drying Your Breastmilk

When your breastmilk is powdered, you can make a bottle on-the-go and add to your babe's foods as they grow. You'll never waste a drop and your babe will keep getting the undeniable long-term benefits of your liquid gold.

Can I Ship My Frozen Breastmilk?
Booby Food makes shipping your frozen breastmilk EASY & SAFE across Canada, USA and beyond!
How We Keep Your Breastmilk Safe In Transit
What About High Lipase Breastmilk?

Freeze-drying helps to tame the overpowering smell/taste of high-lipase breastmilk. Your babe is more likely to take bottles again and you can use your freeze-dried breastmilk in their foods so they'll keep getting the protective health benefits.

Thank GOODNESS!!! Book My Service, Now!
Rescue "Older" Breastmilk from Your Freezer
Yes, you can freeze-dry breastmilk older than 12 months!

For older milk, current guidelines on expressed breastmilk storage state that breastmilk 6-12m is of the highest quality, and “freezing keeps food safe almost indefinitely.”
A.K.A. Your breastmilk does not expire.

How Old is Too Old?

If your stash is under 12 months you can still use it for a bottle (even if stored in an upright/top freezer).

Breastmilk older than 12 months may have reduced nutritional value than when freshly expressed, but it is not expired and hasn’t “gone bad,” which is a common misconception.   

For stashes older than 12m it's recommended to use your freeze-dried breastmilk in your babe's foods as they grow.

Real-Life Mama Stories
How Freeze-Drying Breastmilk Works
The Original Superfood
Booby Food set the standards for the industry, as the first breastmilk freeze-drying service in the world, est. 2018.

Started by a mama who needed help for her health-compromised babe, Booby Food was born out of necessity (because necessity is truly the "mother" of all invention). We're often copied, but never the same.

Booby Food remains a 100% mom/female-owned, family-run business with high safety standards, integrity and heart.

Humbly thankful to have been featured on:

Giving Back to the Community

Not all babies have the best start in life, and for them access to the highest quality nutrition is critical. As a Mama of a babe who was born a medical condition, it is especially important to make sure we gave back to the community with #BoobyFoodFeeds.

Booby Food donates a portion of sales from every service to the NorthernStar Mothers Milk Bank to help feed NICU babies and health compromised newborns all over Canada.

Feel good knowing when you book a Booby Food service you’re also helping to feed a baby in need.

We are an extension of your business - a partner that can help you effectively and efficiently (and immediately!) get to market. Demand and change are two things that our team gets excited about. Why? Because we have the experience, expertise, and operations to deliver on and meet both.

Services we take aim at (and hit!)
Variety Packs
Variety Packs

Consumers love variety packs! Exceptional value to your market by providing variety and diversity through the combination of multiple products. We can do this for you

Learn more
Retail Displays
Retail Displays

Effectively assemble your custom retail displays, load them with your products, and make them ready for distribution. Let Bullseye help showcase your product.

Learn more
Bundle Wrapping
Bundle Wrapping

Today’s consumers are looking for innovative products with high levels of design and style. Bullseye Packaging offers custom printed shrink applications, giving your products an outstanding appearance.

Learn more
Kitting & Assembly
Kitting & Assembly

Arranging products - sometimes a variety of products - can be a daunting process. Bullseye will make sure that your product is packaged and displayed in a way that dazzles and delights.

Learn more
eCommerce & Fulfillment
eCommerce & Fulfillment

Rely on Bullseye to pull and prepare your e-commerce orders. When we put our system to work, customer satisfaction increases, orders are accurately picked, and product is shipped on time.

Learn more
Promotional Packs
Promotional Packs

Adding a little delight - a sample, a gift, a coupon, a gift card - can help you stand out among your competition.

Learn more
Why co-pack?

Ineffective. Time-consuming. Complicated. Sound familiar?

Yes, variety packs, specialty packs, and displays can be all of that. But Bullseye removes the struggles and simplifies things for your company - we’ll do all the assembly and preparation for your variety pack in our warehouse.

Send us your bulk product, packaging, and finished format specs and we’ll implement your marketing or production plans for you. No need to flex your staffing size, shut down your production line, or segregate your warehouse space. You can keep focusing on what you do best, and we’ll do what we do best.

Together, we’ll produce simply amazing products.

About the Calgary Chamber

The Calgary Chamber of Commerce exists to help businesses reach their potential. As an independent, non-profit, non-partisan organization founded in 1891, we build on our history to serve and advocate for businesses of all sizes, in all sectors across the city.

NON-PROFITS RECEIVE 15% OFF THEIR MEMBERSHIP!

The Calgary Chamber is an unwavering advocate for our city's community champions. In recognition of the important work they do, all registered charities and Alberta-based non-profits receive a discount on their membership rate. Contact us to learn more.

HOME

Calgary Italian Bakery, a family owned and operated bakery and deli founded in 1962 is committed to providing quality products that meet customer specifications. We are committed to travel along the path of integrity without looking back, adjusting to an ever-changing road while holding on to our unchanging principles.

Quality is our measure of success as we continue to produce consistent and safe products. We continue to strive for excellence and to lead the market in quality initiatives. We place a strong emphasis on food safety through implementation of a HACCP program, employee training and controlled activities and work processes.

We believe that quality is a joint effort and every person working with us directly impacts the quality of our product. It is the responsibility of all employees to conduct their activities in a manner that will ensure that all food safety and quality parameters are met.

Our promise to you and your family is the same promise we made to our family – to never do anything we couldn’t tell our Mothers about.

Created 29 August 2024

Sustainable choices are a requirement for most businesses today, but how do you discern what criteria to prioritize? There can be significant disparities among filters - not only in efficiency but also in energy expenses. We’ll walk you through the key factors to consider for a sustainable choice without compromising on quality.

Sustainability Innovation technology and research

Considerations for choosing a sustainable HVAC filter
Created 29 August 2024

Try to imagine the most sustainable air filter. What does it look like? Is it made of responsibly sourced materials? Or maybe the components are biobased and renewable? Or do you think about a filter that will biodegrade after it has served its function? All these may contribute to a more sustainable air filter.

OUR STORY

In the year 2000, Swiss immigrant Armin Mueller ignited the bison revolution by acquiring 400 bison cows, birthing Canadian Rangeland Bison (Rangeland) as a pioneer in unwavering quality amid the vast Canadian prairies. Today, Rangeland stands as a global leader in bison excellence, rooted in a commitment to local producers and ethical partnerships, offering certified bison products of impeccable quality.

Today, Rangeland proudly stands as a testament to its legacy, fostering a commitment to local producers and ethical partnerships. Certified as bison marketers in collaboration with SGS, our offerings represent a standard of impeccable quality, challenging the norms of expediency in favor of authenticity.

Our journey continues with a new chapter, as Rangeland Bison brings together the Peace River Ranch (Fort St. John BC), Klukus Lake Ranch (Tomslake BC), Pilatus Ranch (Bentley AB), and Liberty Run Ranch (Windthorst SK). This collective partnership not only continues the rich legacy established by Armin Mueller but also champions land stewardship and the cultivation of food that promotes health for both individuals and the planet.

Supported by a network of over 50 ranchers in Western Canada, Rangeland’s mission spearheads regenerative agriculture towards a better world. Taste the essence of Canada’s heartlands through Rangeland’s meats—an embodiment of a pure legacy, plated for discerning palates, and a saga of tamed dreams unfolding with every bite.

READ MORE

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

RANGELAND RANCHERS: BOLD BISON STEWARDS

At Canadian Rangeland Bison, our ranchers redefine animal welfare. Our bison inhabit their natural kingdom, where vast space for roaming and grazing is their birthright. With minimal trucking, their stress is obliterated, and our quality soars.

Bound by a fierce commitment, our ranchers elevate the standards of raising and producing these magnificent beasts. No antibiotics, no growth boosters, no animal by-products—that’s their vow. It’s a resounding ode to humane treatment and respect.

The anthem is our Canadian heritage, from birth to plate. Space, freedom, and instinct thrive here. Our ranchers fuel the journey of those who nurture their animals in nature’s embrace. At Rangeland, it’s not just about raising bison; it’s about shaping a revolution.

WHAT WE OFFER

RBD Canola Oil

Description: Produced using an advanced expeller-pressed mechanical process, providing a natural and nutrient-rich feed.

Benefits: Free from chemicals, high in protein, and promotes healthy growth in livestock.

Applications: Suitable for poultry, cattle, and swine feed.

Canadian Reporting Requirements Start Now!

Carbon Reporting in Canada is here. It is driven by multiple factors such as stakeholder demand, including retailer requirements to set science-based targets.  Recently introduced “Greenwashing” regulations plus the impending Carbon Reporting requirements for publicly listed entities coupled with the stakeholder demand, have made Carbon Accounting and Reporting a reality. Food and Beverage companies must act now to stay competitive.

Fact 1
F&B Companies supplying large Retailers need to set Science-based Targets by 2027. Science -Based Targets require companies to first measure carbon emissions and then disclose progress over time.
Fact 2
The process of mandating Carbon Reporting has begun. Public Consultation on the proposed sustainability disclosure standards for publicly listed companies in Canada ended June 10, 2024.
Fact  3
International reporting requirements in the US and particularly the EU are well ahead of Canada and impacting international growth opportunities for Canadian Companies.
Fact  4
Following recently introduced regulations in the EU, “Greenwashing” regulations are now Law in Canada under Bill C-59. Companies will need to back up climate claims with evidence or face penalties.

Following the international adoption of mandated reporting requirements across the globe, including in the EU and US, further fueled by customer demand, Carbon Reporting in Canada is here. To avoid losing market share, deflating growth and shrinking investment opportunities, Canadian Food and Beverage companies need to act now.

Need proof or want to learn more? Book 20 mins with us and we'll explain how Carbon Reporting will impact your company and the risk of not acting now.

Creating a more
food secure world

Our planet’s population is growing rapidly — and so is the need for more food. Already, 800 million people go to bed hungry each night. As a food company to the world, Cargill is partnering with farmers and customers to grow and produce more food with less impact, to move that food to store shelves and family tables, and to nourish people for a more food secure world.​

2024 Impact Report
Delivering impact with purpose and partnership

Our food system’s biggest challenges — from climate change to food security — require big thinking and bold action.  

In Cargill’s 2024 Impact Report, we detail how we’re partnering to decarbonize the food system, help farmers and food producers succeed, and create value in the communities where our people live and work.

From reducing emissions in our operations to scaling regenerative agriculture, see how we’re working together to build a more sustainable and resilient food system.

Our purpose
To nourish the world in a safe, responsible and sustainable way

Sitting at the heart of the global supply chain, we join farmers, ranchers, manufacturers, foodservice customers and retailers in sourcing, making and delivering products that are vital for living.​

Every day, our 160,000 team members come to work:​

Driven to improve lives through food, nutrition and health​
Looking for ways to innovate with purpose​
Committed to nourishing our growing world by providing access to life’s essentials​

This is how we create new opportunities for our customers to grow, communities to prosper and consumers to live well.

A COMPANY BUILT ON DEDICATION & EXPERTISE

Established in 1962, Chamco has become a market leader in engineered pump and compressor solutions over the past six decades. Chamco’s impressive project portfolio spans some of the world’s most extreme and challenging environments.
From the hot desert sands to the harsh winters, no matter the location or climate, Chamco continues to provide trusted compressor and pump solutions to various industries around the globe.

World’s Best Pet Food

Founded in a small town in Alberta, Canada, Champion has grown to be a key player in the premium pet food industry with products sold in over 90 countries. By focusing exclusively on crafting premium pet food, we perfect our recipes and innovate new, quality foods that help pets thrive for a lifetime.

While many foods leave your pet feeling full, ORIJEN™ can truly nourish them with premium animal ingredients. Inspired by what your pet’s ancestors ate in the wild, ORIJEN® food is packed with up to 90%* animal ingredients like meat, poultry or fish. See for yourself and compare ORIJEN to other diets here.
*Approximate and derived from the unprocessed state of the ingredients .

Look at other pet food brands and you’ll find things we never add in our kitchen, like wheat, corn and soy, at the top of their ingredient lists. Compare that to the protein-rich meat, poultry and fish ingredients that are thoughtfully balanced with whole fruit and vegetables found in ACANA™ pet food recipes. You’ll immediately see the difference.

Expert Food Plant Sanitation Services

Helping the Sucess of Alberta’s Food Industry

CNC was incorporated in 2011 by Chad Hausch, who has more than 30 years experience in the food plant sanitation industry. Chad took his passion for sanitation and his extensive knowledge to help and improve other sanitation programs with value added services, customer relationships, cost savings and innovation. 

These engrained values have been the foundation of his success and the reason that CNC has been able to build strong relationships with many food plants throughout Alberta. Chad provides sanitation services you can trust.

Our goal is to stand out above the rest; providing the best staff, training and services to our customers. We go above and beyond to ensure safe food products and a healthy facility environment. We achieve this by providing services that typical sanitation contractors do not.

Our Services

Food Plant Sanitation

Our expert team uses advanced techniques and top-quality cleaning agents to minimize bacterial contamination, equipment damage, and downtime. With our chemical expertise, we create sanitation programs that ensure compliance with regulations while boosting the safety and efficiency of your operations.

Read more
Kitchen / Exhaust Hood Cleaning

Restaurants can look no further when it comes to their kitchen cleaning!

CNC offers free sanitation consulting while cleaning your exhaust hoods, greasy equipment and much more.

Read more
Industrial / Overhead Cleaning

Why Choose CNC Contract Cleaning Services?

Family Run Business

No matter how big your operation is, we make sure all our customers feel like family when they choose CNC to become their sanitation partner

Custom Solutions:

We develop cleaning plans specifically tailored to meet your industry’s regulations and unique facility needs. Biofilm Treatments, Steaming, and more.

Cutting-Edge Techniques:

We employ state-of-the-art equipment and eco-friendly cleaning products to deliver exceptional results while minimizing environmental impact.

Want to Know More?

CNC has a goal of providing the best sanitation services at the best price for our food industry. Understanding the importance of safe food in our community is our top priority and sharing this knowledge is what we strive to do.

Contact us

Ready to experience a new level of cleanliness? Contact us today to learn more about our industrial and overhead cleaning services or to schedule a consultation.

Contact Us Today!

Welcome

We are a locally owned ice manufacturing company servicing the Edmonton area since 2001. We supply bagged ice delivery for construction, festivals, liquor stores, restaurants and more. We are now servicing the Calgary area and will provide ice delivery in Calgary and surrounding cities. Please check out About Us page for more information.

FIND OUT MORE
Land Acknowledgement

Awasâpisk miskwamiy (Columbia Ice) acknowledges and is mindful that its ice factory is situated on the traditional territory of the maskêkosihk (Enoch Cree Nation) located in kihci asotamâkêwin nikotwâsik (Treaty 6 Territory).

The Little Guys

Some other ice companies act like they're too big to take your business seriously. But we're a little guy, just like you. We're ready to take your needs seriously, and provide the best customer service we can.

Supporting Alberta Business

We're an Alberta owned and operated business. We believe in supporting other locally owned business, because when one of us wins, we all win. Supporting local has never been so important, and we take pride in helping other Alberta business.

Your Seed is our Business

Columbia Seed Co. Ltd. (CSL) was established in 1964. The main purpose then was the production of quality seed peas for the United Kingdom, Asia, and Europe. With changes in world trade over the past fifty years our company has had to change as well.

​

Our company established the green pea export standard for Canadian Green Peas many years ago with our variety 'Radley'. Bred by Columbia Seed Co. Ltd. owners at the time, Sharpes International Seeds in Sleaford, UK.

​

CSL today is owned by an affiliate company of XPT Grain Inc. This acquisition was made on July 1, 2021.

​

We are Contractors, Processors and Marketers of Specialty Agricultural Products located in Vauxhall, Alberta, Canada.

​

Our specialty are Marrowfat Peas for consumption, we thrive to produce the quality needed by our clients and aim to gain the trust of our customers.

CSL processes specialty legumes (vining pea seed, garden pea seed) and some cover crop seed for breeding companies and seed houses as well as peas, faba beans & cickpeas for human consumption.

Our processing capacity is up to 12 MT per hour, bagged product,   either 25-50 kg or mini bulk bags up to 1,075 kg.

​

The equipment we use is the most modern and efficient on the market. Air & and screen unit running with 50% of its capacity, gravity and de-stoner units well equipped for any large and small seed, color sorting on every lot, not only when needed.

​

We are licensed under the Canadian Seed Institut.

​

https://csi-ics.com/canadian-seed-institute

​

We are licensed under the Canadian Grain Commission and accredited under their HACCP Program.

​

https://www.grainscanada.gc.ca/en/

​

More information about Pulses and the Pulse Industry in Canada can be found at Pulse Canada.

​

http://www.pulsecanada.com/

​

We trade and ship worldwide
We grow and purchase our products locally, research for optimum varieties and closely oversee production
We load and seal your containers right on site to guarantee lot integrity
We load your order as per your specifications and ship it right to your door

WHO WE ARE & WHAT WE DO 
About Us

We are a manufacturing company located in Leduc, Alberta, Canada. Offering different options of Latin foods.

We are so committed to using only the freshest of ingredients, and making our products from scratch daily, and that we have built our entire manufacturing process around it. It is called lean manufacturing, where fresh ingredients arrive precisely when we need them. All of our products are proudly Gluten Free.

Our goals are that you enjoy the original flavours of Latin America in your home; you can now find this versatile food in restaurants and in grocery stores. More locations to be added in the near future.

First Choice
SAUCES
SHOP ONLINE
SAUCES
GUACAMOLE STYLE

This sauce is made of jalapeno pepper, tomatillo, habanero pepper, onion, garlic, salt, spices, canola oil. This delicious creamy sauce combines the flavours of jalapenos, garlic and tomatillos. Not only is it the best selling salsa, but this salsa also has a beautiful kick of spice and flavour.

Engineering excellence that is on time and on budget
DGH Engineering provides consulting and design services for construction, industrial, commercial and agri-food businesses.
High-performance building

With 30 years of engineering experience in Canada, we know how to collaborate with owners, developers, and contractors.

DGH is 100% Canadian owned by a group of dedicated employees who are committed to providing work that consistently achieves a level of excellence in meeting client needs.

DGH departments can work independently or together as determined by the client.

Working together, all departments collaborate from the project conception to completion, ensuring all systems work in harmony.

The result? A high-performance building that is cost-effective over its life cycle, efficient, safe, functional, flexible, and sustainable.

Distribution Qualtech est une compagnie canadienne reconnue comme un des leaders dans la vente d’équipement de procédés dans les secteurs agroalimentaire (produits laitiers, jus et bières) et pharmaceutique.




 Nous sommes le plus important distributeur au Canada pour les produits  Alfa Laval ,  Tetra Pak ,  Fristam ,  Tuchenhagen ,  Anderson  et  Krohne .




 Nos gammes de produits comblent parfaitement les différents besoins de notre clientèle. De plus, notre savoir-faire au niveau des procédés nous permet d’offrir à nos clients un service complet et recherché. Nos solutions sont utilisées par des centaines d’entreprises à travers le Canada et les États-Unis. 

Enfin, notre excellente collaboration avec nos fournisseurs nous permet d’avoir des prix hautement compétitifs.


VOIR+ 
SERVICE



Notre équipe de service est disponible afin de vous appuyer dans l’entretien et la vérification de votre équipement. Nous sommes disponibles pour vous aider dans la planification et la mise en œuvre de vos projets et/ou entretien préventif. Nous pouvons vous accompagner dans toutes les étapes de votre projet : de la sélection de vos instruments jusqu’à l’installation.


Nos techniciens sont disponibles pour faire l’étalonnage de la majorité de vos instruments de mesure et de contrôle ainsi que pour effectuer la vérification de systèmes de pasteurisation et/ou de procédés aseptiques (UHT).


Nous offrons également un service d’assistance et/ou de formation pour l’entretien de valves, de pompes et d’échangeurs à plaques. 


Un service de mécanique spécialisé vous est aussi proposé pour l’entretien de séparateurs ou d’homogénéisateurs.

Welcome to Edmonton Potato Growers Cooperative

” The Origin of EPG “

In January of 1960 a small group of local potato and vegetable farmers in the Edmonton, Alberta area decided to try an innovative alternative to conventional produce marketing.

If they could work together to avoid competing with one another, they could improve their efficiency AND be more profitable.

In 1968, after nearly a decade of working and marketing their produce together, the group centralized sales and distribution, building a warehouse in west Edmonton near what would be the Yellowhead Trail ( HWY 16 ) and 170 Street. ( A dirt road at this time. Not gravel – dirt! )

OUR STORY

Until EPIC, eggs farmed in Alberta were shipped out of province to be processed, returning to Alberta as a finished good.  Over 140 egg farms joined together to form a cooperative to support the industry known as Egg Processing Innovations Cooperative (EPIC). We came together to create a sustainable future for eggs in Alberta.

 
PARTNERSHIP

Since the partnership with EggSolutions, EPIC became EggSolutions EPIC.

EggSolutions EPIC KEY PILLARS


OUR MISSION:

To deliver Value-Added products and increase revenue to our agricultural and economic stakeholders; as well as local Alberta communities

OUR VISSION:

Honour all of our stakeholders through a collaborative approach which addresses evolving needs of manufacturers and consumers

OUR VALUES:

EggSolutions EPIC is committed to Sustainable, Local and Flexible business actions – doing what is best for each of our partners throughout the supply chain. By doing this, we strengthen our position to simulate innovation and develop new products to grow the category.

Did you know
The word tortillaoriginates from
the Spanish word ‘tort’ which
means cake.
Tortillas are essentially little corn cakes, flattened and unsweetened.

just
Spanish! In some parts of
southern
Spain,

tortillas are made from chickpeas and fried until crispy.

They look similar to corn tortillas, but actually originated
in Greece, and were brought to Spain by
Arabs hundreds of years ago.
The corn tortillas we know and love started

  out in what we now call Central and
South America.

Unleash the Power of Lean

LEAN CONSULTING    LEAN TRAINING    LEAN FOR SMALL BUSINESS

Transform Your Manufacturing Operations

Welcome to a world where operational challenges meet their match. As a Manufacturing Leader, you’re on the frontline navigating through a maze of increasing costs, inefficiencies, and quality concerns that threaten to undermine your hard-earned success. At Engineering Possibilities, we understand the gravity of these issues and the impact they have on your bottom line and reputation.

 

 

You’re battling on multiple fronts – soaring operating expenses, productivity bottlenecks, and quality issues that erode customer trust. Overproduction, excessive waste, and extended lead times are not just operational nuisances; they’re barriers to your growth and competitiveness in a fast-paced market.

Enter Lean – not just a methodology, but a transformative philosophy designed to streamline your operations, enhance quality, and significantly reduce costs. Lean is about doing more with less, focusing on value from your customer’s perspective, eliminating waste, and empowering your team to think, act, and innovate towards continuous improvement.

At Engineering Possibilities, we specialize in making Lean not only accessible but highly effective for small to mid-size manufacturing companies. Through personalized consulting and dynamic training sessions, including our unique Chaos Racing simulation, we bring the principles of Lean to life. Our approach is hands-on, engaging, and tailored to address the specific challenges and opportunities within your operations.

 

Imagine a future where every process is optimized, waste is minimized, and your team is energized by the improvements they contribute to daily. This is not just a vision; it’s a tangible outcome of embracing Lean with Engineering Possibilities. Let’s work together to transform your operational challenges into your competitive advantage.

WORK WITH US
Transform your Manufacturing Operations with Lean Solutions

Book a Complimentary 30 Minute Discovery Call to Create What’s Possible for your Organization

Discover the transformative power of Lean to streamline your operations, reduce costs, and increase productivity. We’ll explore what’s possible for your organization and create your customize Lean Pathway for process efficiency.

Complete Sustainability Solutions.

Partner with Enviro–Stewards to sustainably conserve energy and resources, optimize yield, and profitably reduce environmental footprints. Servicing industries from automotive to pharmaceutical to food & beverage, we’re here to help.

SCHEDULE A FREE ASSESSMENT
Top 6 Reasons to Choose Enviro-Stewards
Meet or exceed Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) goals.
Reduce utility spend.
Reach corporate sustainability targets, from energy reduction to waste minimization goals.
Achieve carbon neutral or net zero targets.
Implement and track solutions to help goals become reality.
Monitor process improvements and identify new opportunities.
What Enviro-Stewards Can Do For You

Our root cause-based approach effectively identifies practical and affordable sustainability solutions that help decarbonize facilities and supply chains while cutting costs. These savings support the final steps toward achieving net zero and beyond, using socially equitable Gold Standard offsets, renewable energy, or other strategic investments aligned with your organization’s mission.

Why Choose Enviro-Stewards?

Our team consists of seasoned professionals who are passionate about engineering change. We believe that practical solutions are the most effective way to achieve long-lasting sustainability goals.

Here’s how we can help:
Detailed Assessments: We conduct comprehensive audits to understand your current environmental impact.
Customized Solutions: Based on the assessments, we design strategies that align with your company’s sustainability goals.
Implementation and Monitoring: Our support continues with the implementation of solutions, ensuring they deliver the intended environmental and economic benefits.
Big Saving for Jackson Triggs

Jackson Triggs Winery saves 50% on their wastewater treatment system with Preventative Measures deployed by Enivro-Stewards.

6 Steps to Success: Our Sustainable Solutions From Start to Finish

Our focused approach consistently identifies practical and affordable measures that decarbonize facilities & supply chains while reducing cost. These savings subsidize the last mile of the journey to net zero and beyond with (social equity based) Gold Standard offsets, renewables, or other investments tailored to your organization’s purpose.

About Us

Strategically located in the Edmonton Research Park, EPSILON CHEMICALS LTD. was founded in 1990 as a research and development company to provide specialized products and services to industry. 

The FOOD PLANT SANITATION GROUP of Epsilon Chemicals Ltd. is in the business of solving sanitation problems for the food industry by offering a complete consultation service as well as a complete line of chemical cleaners, chemical sanitizers and dispensing and application equipment.

The INDUSTRIAL GROUP of Epsilon Chemicals Ltd. provides innovative cleaning solutions to a variety of industries, including the oil industry.  Our research and development department have formulated a wide range of environmentally responsible and safe specialty-cleaning products, including excellent products specific to the cost-effective removal of bitumen and heavy oil deposits.

The ENVIRONMENTAL GROUP of Epsilon Chemicals Ltd. specializes in the study and treatment of wastewater streams for the Food Industry.  Its objective is to identify and develop innovative new products and optimized approaches to effluent treatment so that plants meet government standards and operate within permit compliance.

CLEAN START DISINFECTANT
60 second kill time for SARS-CoV-2

CLEAN START DISINFECTANT is a ready to use broad-spectrum virucidal hard surface cleaner and disinfectant that inactivates SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19). This product is also a fungicide, mildewstat, and tuberculocide.

Clean Start Disinfectant TDS
DISINFECTION AND CLEANING VERIFICATION
Verify surface cleanliness in as little as 10 seconds

While methods to clean and sanitize surfaces vary, the need to measure the effectiveness of cleaning practices is universal. Contaminated surfaces and equipment can quickly lead to microbial contamination, and ultimately, the infection of patients or personnel.

Read More
Realzyme’s Enzymatic Filter Detergents

Crystal-clear beverages require impeccable filtration. Enzymatic cleaners help ensure this by efficiently degrading residues that clog filters. From fruit juices to dairy products to soft drinks and more, these enzyme-based detergents improve filtration operations, resulting in visually appealing and tastier beverages. Discover how enzymatic solutions are raising the bar in beverage clarity. There are multiple ranges of products in the Filzym line based on the application and what is required, how difficult the cleaning process is, the volume of the system, and many other factors.

Your source for quality meats

We are a specialty meat, processing, procurement, and distribution company providing high quality meat products and services to customers in the Canadian, and International markets.

We have built the business around our mission, and our core values of customer service, integrity, people, quality, and safety.

Our Services Markets We Serve Service Diversity
Internationally trusted brands

Our Brands are recognized globally as some of the finest meat products available in the market. When you purchase one of our branded products from Donald's Fine Foods you can expect a fantastic tasting product that has been selected and trimmed to meet the most exacting specifications.

View our brands
Our commitment to food safety

At Donald’s Fine Foods we strive to provide the safest quality meat products available. Advanced sanitation systems are installed throughout our facilities to improve the plant sanitation processes. State of the art refrigeration systems are installed to perfectly control environment for fresh and frozen meat storage. Our programs provide real-time monitoring of all systems and temperatures on a continuous basis.

Learn more
Corporate Responsibility

As a family, we partner with our employees and suppliers to provide our customers with high quality food products that meet their needs through innovation and customer service. We are also committed to contribute to the environment and give back to the communities.

Learn more
30 years and counting

Donald’s Fine Foods group of companies and our brands have been recognized for 30 years providing the highest quality meat products and customer service in our industry. We work passionately to produce and satisfy the needs of our customers and deliver the freshest quality meat products grown by our farming partner families. All while maintaining the highest standards in food safety.

Our responsibilities

The Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation is responsible for:

policies, legislation, regulations and services necessary for Alberta’s agriculture and food sectors to grow, prosper and diversify
inspiring public confidence in the quality and safety of food
supporting environmentally sustainable resource management practices

Workforce development is about people and a love for skills.

At Food Processing Skills Canada, our mission is to make certain that the Canadian food and beverage manufacturing sector is building an empowered and resilient workforce that is primed for growth. We create industry-driven programs for Canada’s 13,000+ food and beverage manufacturing establishments and the sector’s 300,000+ people so that businesses and individuals can achieve their goals.

With Food Processing Skills Canada, it’s about making certain that Canadians, new immigrants, and temporary foreign workers have the training and confidence to successfully begin an exciting job or advance their career. It is also about ensuring employers and educators have the right resources to nurture talent and create the perfect learning environment.

GET STARTED
From Compliance Hurdles to Food Safety Triumphs

With over 100 combined years of experience in the food industry in manufacturing, auditing and regulatory sectors, Food Safety Solutions Inc. can provide the assistance you need to develop, maintain and improve your food safety systems.

We specialize in consulting, auditing and training in the food processing, food service, packaging, retail and distribution sectors.

We have experience in many food commodities including red meat and poultry slaughter and processing, bakery, fruit and vegetable production and processing, seafood manufacturing, retail and food service, cold storage and distribution, ingredient and confectionery and packaging material manufacturing.

Our goal is to work with your company to provide you with customized solutions that will enable you to effectively and efficiently meet your food safety and quality goals and requirements. No matter how large or small the company, we can help find the right solution for your business.

Our Services
Auditing

We are experts in GFSI standards, regulatory audit standards and facility self-assessment audits.

What We Do

Over the last four decades, Glenmore has helped some of the most successful brands across North America sell their products. As one of the Continent's top custom manufacturers of custom printed paperboard boxes, labels, shrink sleeves, tubes, and commercial print, Glenmore is your best option for printed products that exceed your expectations.

We deliver expert service from concept to completion. With a full in-house finishing department that is second-to-none, everything we produce is printed and assembled under our roof resulting in the highest levels of quality control in the industry, lower costs, quicker turnaround times, and the highest levels of privacy. Our award-winning array of offerings help ensure the best results for your next project.

Paperboard Boxes

As the Premiere folding carton manufacturer in North America, Glenmore’s quality and attention to detail are second to none.

Pressure Sensitive Rolls Labels

Glenmore is a best in class producer of custom labels of any size, shape, or volume, with any finish.

Books, Brochures and Folded Inserts

Glenmore’s dedicated print finishing and book binding team goes above and beyond to make sure everything we produce is to your specifications.

Tubes

Bespoke tubes to fit any size bottle or product. Glenmore stands alone as the best composite can manufacturer in North America.

Shrink sleeves and flow wraps

Beautifully printed flexible packaging made to food safe standards.

ABOUT US

Globel Canada Inc. is a consulting and trading corporation specializing in global business development. Its independent consultants and partners have over 40 years of experience in corporate environments in a variety of industry sectors. Our reach includes North America, Latin America, Europe, Southeast Asia, Oceania, and Africa.

Business strategies are customized and tailored to its client's needs and target markets.

It started in 2001 in Calgary, Alberta, as CONET – Consulting Network Ltd.

 

 

OUR MISSION

To assist our clients on facing and overcoming their business challenges and achieving success, worldwide.

OUR VISION

Our vision is to be the preferred business development partner for our clients.

OUR CORE VALUES

Focus on Results | Professionalism | Accountability | Commitment | Ethics | Excellence.

 

 
MEMBERSHIPS AND AFFILIATIONS

As a global service provider in business development, sales, and marketing, our memberships and affiliations help us to increase networking opportunities and go further to execute the plans we design. Globel Canada is a member of and affiliated with professional  associations, educational institutions, and non-profit organizations.

All About Upcycling.

Upcycling is taking something that is considered waste and re-purposing it. As opposed to recycling, in upcycling, those materials are used to create a product of higher quality or value.

Read Up

FAQs + Tips.

Check out the nutritional benefits of our products & get some inspiration on how to use them.

from 16 reviews
Upcycled barley flour

I’m not much a baker and use barley flour in a countertop bread maker. I had been adding a couple of tablespoons of an upcycled barley flour for about a year now. I liked the added flavor with the carbo-reduced flour I use.
Yours definitely adds a good, new level of flavor as I hoped. A good choice for me. Keep up the good work.
Jim in Reno, NV

Anonymous

Love the way it makes my skin feel

Born again Brownies.

These are very different from your regular rich (sickly) Brownies! They're just the right sweetness and notes of coffee filtering through the chocolate! The slight texture adds dimension, for an overall taste treat packed with Fibre and protein! Onto the carrot cake mix next!

Leah mitchell
Must have

Absolutely love this product. Evens out my skin tone and gives it a fresh glow. Been using it for over a year now and not sure how many I have gifted -it’s a game changer.

Sanja Joly
Delicious pancakes!

I just made the last batch of pancakes from my first bag of this pancake mix, and I love them. They taste great - much deeper flavour than white flour pancakes. And they’re easy to make - just add water! I highly recommend, especially for folks who like the Kodiak high-protein pancakes.

I was a big consumer of the kodiak cakes this is a great new option for my pantry!

brownies

I was wrong

Free Range Berkshire Pork

Irvings Farm is home to a small herd of Free Range Berkshire Pigs, Our pigs are outside year round, and have the freedom to do what pigs do naturally. Learn more about our pigs and the way we raise them.

LEARN MORE
Farm Store!!!

SATURDAY 10am – 4pm
All other days – please call 780-672-2787

LEARN MORE
Real farmhouse taste!

Full selection of traditionally drycured bacon and hams, and an extensive range of delicious fresh sausages to make your mouth water! Free from artificial flavours and colours, and made in a facility that doesn’t use any gluten, dairy, eggs, soy, nuts or MSG.

VIEW OUR PRODUCTS
Berkshire Pork Cuts: Fresh from the farm!

Berkshire pork cut fresh every week, and for sale at Farmers’ Markets and retail outlets. We offer a full range of retail and custom cuts, prepared the old fashioned way, and roasts with skin on for crackling! What special cuts do you need?

LEARN MORE
Learn more about Nicola & Alan Irving

Nicola and Alan Irving have lived in Canada since 2005, and their love of farming and great food is now their way of life. It was a need to find a taste of England that prompted them to bring Irvings Farm Fresh to life!

READ MORE
Specializing in Premium Quality Pork Products

WE ARE BASED IN ALBERTA, CANADA - WE ARE NOT PERMITTED TO SELL OUTSIDE OF THE PROVINCE OF ALBERTA

Thank you for considering Irvings Farm Fresh as your pork supplier. If you are looking for delicious, nutritious, free range  and locally sourced pork, wish to support your local small scale farmer, and want to know where your meat comes from and how it is produced, then Irvings Farm Fresh is your supplier.

Having grown up in the UK, we offer a taste of home for British expat customers and a promise that we will provide "pork to make every meal amazing!".

Our small family farm is located near Round Hill, which is situated about one hour SE of Edmonton, Alberta.

Our farm is home to our herd of Free Range Berkshire pigs. The pigs are raised outside year round and allowed the freedom to behave naturally. We cut pork every week to supply our Farmers' Markets with fresh cuts of Berkshire Pork. We also source additional RWA (raised without antibiotics) pork from another local farm so we have enough to keep up with the demand for your favourite sausages, bacon and hams. All of our pork is produced without the use of added hormones or antibiotics.

Our recently expanded Butcher Shop is also located on our farm. This is a spacious, modern facility, where all of our products are carefully produced to the highest possible standards. All of our products are made from scratch, using our own recipes, in an allergen friendly facility, with simple fresh ingredients and using traditional production methods. We source our ingredients locally wherever possible. 

Our pork products are proudly served on the menu at many great restaurants and are available for purchase at several Farmers' Markets and independent retailers across Alberta.

VISIT OUR FARM STORE - OPEN SATURDAY 10am - 4pm, and MONDAY - FRIDAY by appointment or call ahead to check we are home. 780-672-2787

We sell our full range of pork products, both fresh and frozen, along with a selection of other locally sourced artisanal food items. Our opening hours are Saturday from 10 am until 4 pm, and Monday to Friday by appointment. You are welcome to come Monday to Friday, but please call ahead if you are making a special trip and we will make sure somebody is here.

We would like to invite you to take some time and look around our website, discover what we have to offer, and to pass back comments or questions to us via the contact us page.

- Alan and Nicola Irving

Our Approach to Net Zero

Our five initial steps to reach net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2040 include:

Investing more than $1 billion in upgrading facilities and equipment by 2030.
Investing $100 million in research and development projects by 2030.
Reducing emissions in all JBS facilities by 30% by 2030.
Using 100% renewable electricity by 2040.
Tying environmental performance to executive compensation to ensure accountability.

Jenny's Delectables Inc.
About Us
THE WORLD'S BEST GOURMET POTATO PRODUCTS!

Established in May of 2016, Jenny's Delectables began the production and sale of Gourmet Stuff'd Potatoes, an all natural home-cooked product that quickly grew in popularity throughout Southern Alberta. Available only in Farmer's Markets for the first 2 years, Jenny's found a new home on the shelves of many stores in  Alberta and garnered the attention of larger grocery store chains such as Sobey's, Real Canadian Superstore and CO-OP. Now in over 600 stores across Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Ontario and BC, Jenny's is growing at an incredible rate! With a commitment to local growers and the absolute freshest ingredients available, Jenny's continues to supply the highest quality gourmet food products possible. With our head office in Calgary, the growing demand for Jenny's products is a testament to our unwillingness to waiver from the highest standards.

Happy New Year And All The Best In 2025!
Our Greenhouse, Garden And Market Are Open Year-Round And Open 6 Days A Week. We Continue To Sell Our Home-Grown Winter Vegetables - Sweet Nantes Carrots, Cabbage, Onions, Red And Golden Beets, Russian Red Garlic, Red, White And Yellow Potatoes, Local Fresh Greens From Bruderheim, And Local Tomatoes And Peppers From Lacombe. Our Selection Of 2025 Seeds And Starter Supplies Is In Full Swing. Soils, Fertilizers And Plant Health Products Are Available Everyday. Browse Through Our Seasonal Gift Shop And Stop In The Greenhouse For A Flowering Or Tropical Indoor Plant. There Is Something For Everyone At Kuhlmann’s.
A Bit About Us

Located in Edmonton, Alberta, Kuhlmann’s has been your most trusted family owned and operated greenhouse since 1962. we have a long history of offering the best in our own-grown plants, shrubs, vegetables, our famous Kuhlmanns’ sauerkraut and so much more.

Stop in and see why we continue to be Edmonton’s go-to greenhouse, garden and market.

Kuhlmann’s Garden Market Greenhouse is a major contributor to the Edmonton community. We believe that giving back builds stronger communities and helps bring us closer together as a city.

Check Out Our Vegetable Availability
Support Local
When you buy from Kuhlmann’s, you know you’re getting the best in locally grown and locally sourced plants and vegetables

Kuhlmann’s Greenhouse Garden Market is your place to source the freshest locally grown produce, Kuhlmann’s grows a rich variety of flavourful vegetables which include; beans, beets, broccoli, brussell sprouts, carrots, corn, cabbage, cucumbers, celeriac, cauliflower, dill weed, garlic, kale, leeks, lettuce, onions, parsnips, peas, potatoes, pumpkins, radishes, rutabaga, swiss chard, spinach, squash, tomatoes and zuchini. 

We promise to always bring you the highest standard because that’s what you’ve come to expect from Kuhlmann’s since 1962. We’re not just a family farm, we’re a tradition.

LA MOLIENDA
Online Store B2B and B2C

La Molienda Latin Food Products was established in 2012 in Calgary, Alberta. Our vision has always been to represent Latin America’s people, flavours, aromas, passions, & hospitality through the unique taste of our products.

Throughout the years, we began importing a wider variety of products from various Latin American countries while maintaining our focus on product quality and a unique experience for our customers. Through hard work and dedication, we expanded to offering our services in Edmonton and all-around southern Alberta.

LETHBRIDGE BIOGAS
HOME TECHNICAL OUR PLANT ORGANICS DISPOSAL CONTACT
Welcome to
Lethbridge BioGas.

Lethbridge Biogas uses an anaerobic digestion process operating at 38 degrees C for the production of renewable energy. Anaerobic means ‘in the absence of oxygen.

The Lethbridge biogas/cogeneration plant processes organic residues such as agricultural manures and food processing by-products. It uses the biogas generated in 2 * 1.425 MW combined heat and power units (CHP) to produce green and renewable electricity for the Alberta grid. Heat captured from the CHP’s is used to keep the process at its operating temperature at all times. Situated in the County of Lethbridge ‘Rave Industrial Park’, Lethbridge Biogas has access to an abundance of organic “fuel” within a radius of 2-30 km.

The anaerobic digestion process captures and uses methane, a greenhouse gas 21 times more destructive to the environment than CO2. The remaining by-product of the digestion process is digestate which is used as a high-quality fertilizer for land application. Digestate reduces commercial fertilizer requirements and associated costs. This facility is the first to incorporate patented thermal hydrolysis technology developed in Alberta.

Discover Delicious!
Luco Farms fresh, stoneground, artisan mustards enhance the natural flavors of your food. Our handcrafted mustard products are made from mustard seed grown on our farm and contain only mustard seed, vinegar, water and salt - pure products, grown locally, and contain no unnecessary ingredients.
 

Luco Farms is a family owned business that has been growing award winning pedigree cereal and oilseed crops since 1937. Processing mustard grown on the farm is a natural transition focused on producing  high-quality, fresh mustard products that are free from artificial colourings, preservatives and other non-value added ingredients. Our vision is to provide fresh, pure “farm to fork” products that professional and home chef’s can use to create new and interesting flavour profiles in their cooking.

We hope you enjoy our products.

EMPLOYERS CANDIDATES
WE CONNECT GREAT COMPANIES ... WITH EXCEPTIONAL CANDIDATES

Welcome to MacDonald Search Group – Canada's trusted and experienced executive search and recruitment firm. With offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Toronto, Ottawa, Moncton and Halifax; our goal is simple – finding the right fit for clients and candidates.

And, our physical location does not define our reach - we have successfully filled many roles in other markets like Quebec and the U.S.

Companies and candidates rarely get together by accident. It takes a collaborative approach to combine a client's needs and a candidate's aspirations. With our depth of experience, we’re trusted to bring the two parties together and make that perfect match.

Whether the position is in sales, marketing, management, manufacturing, operations, supply chain, finance or HR across a variety of industries, we work tenaciously to connect great clients with great candidates.

Note: MacDonald Search Group consultants will NEVER engage with candidates or clients via WhatsApp, WeChat or other apps.

WELCOME TO MACKAY’S ICE CREAM!
A TASTE OF TRADITION

Since 1948, MacKay’s Ice Cream has proudly served its locally made, premium ice cream to customers from around the world. As a part of Cochrane’s Historic Downtown, we offer locals and visitors alike a unique menu of ice cream flavours.

As a business that spans three generations (MacKay’s is now owned and operated by Jimmy and Christina’s granddaughter Meghan and her husband Mark), we understand the importance of improving our Environmental footprint, being involved in Our Community, responsible Operations, commitment to Our People, and of course listening to Our Customers. Please read more about us and MacKay’s commitment to these core values.

Take a look at all of our Flavours and come visit us today and find your favorite one!

Our Story

Twenty years ago, Matrix Group Publishing Inc. started with a staff of four. Over the years, the company has built its list of titles, clients, and services, and the company’s 50+ employees are proud to be an integral part of each association’s marketing plans.

A highly skilled workforce is split between Matrix’s headquarters in Winnipeg, Manitoba, and a sales office in Hamilton, Ontario. Much of the team has worked with the company for more than five years, and several have been on staff for more than a decade. Each employee plays a critical role in the overall success of every project, with all departments – from sales, to design, to distribution – working closely to ensure clients are proud of the final product. 

The men and women who work at Matrix Group Publishing Inc. are experts at what they do. They don’t mind hard work; in fact, the more of a magazine’s workload you pass off to them, the better! 

They always hit deadlines.

They always respond to your correspondence.

They always put in the effort required to create a product that everyone is proud of.

Our team is ready to turn your idea for an association magazine into reality!

Jessica Potter

Shoshana Weinberg

Shannon Savory

Allie Kozub

Jenna Collignon

Neil Gottfred

Advertising Executives

Custom Content that Drives Your Conversation

You have an association to run – you’re lobbying; you’re connecting with potential, new, and assisting members; you’re leading your team; and you’re planning your next annual conference and an upcoming webinar.

We get it. You don’t have the time to create a high-quality publication for your organization. But we do! For 20 years, Matrix Group Publishing Inc. has been collaborating with our clients to design magazines, directories, and buyers’ guides that showcase their mission, members, and accomplishments.

A magazine specific to your organization and industry can work for you:

Use it to connect with ALL of your members, and as a showcase piece at your next AGM or trade show.
Use it to reach out to potential members, showing them why they should join your organization.
Use it as a lobbying tool to easily reach sector leaders, the leaders of other organizations, and government.
Use it to create awareness about the importance of your industry and members to those who may not be aware.
Beginning, Middle, and End
Matrix Group Publishing Inc. takes care of everything!

Advertising

Editorial

Design

Printing

Distribution

Collections

Connecting Online

More Services

As your publisher, we’ll take care of as little or as much of the work as you need. You determine your own involvement, and we’ll work with you to create a schedule that will keep the entire project on track. We are excited to work with you to create your magazine, your way. Oh, and guess what – it’s free! If you’d like to present our services to your Board, please get in touch and request a portfolio that outlines our services, and includes client testimonials and printed examples of our work.

Target Your Services to the Right Readers

Let’s say you sell brake lights for heavy duty vehicles. Advertising in a magazine specific to transportation equipment – that is mailed directly to the purchasing powers working in this industry – will yield results.

THIS IS THE POWER OF ASSOCIATION-DRIVEN MAGAZINES. 

Association magazines are all about industry. A trucking magazine is going to feature articles about trucking and showcase trucking-related products. This means it’s going to be read by the very people you want to target your trucking-related products to. This example is applicable across the board. Association magazines make good business sense because you know who is reading these magazines so you can target your ads and reap the rewards. Our magazines are all mailed directly to our association clients’ members and most are also scheduled around industry events that our associations are involved in. If you want to know more about how we can connect you with industry-specific buying powers, contact us for a list of titles we publish and industries we are experts in.

Want to know more? Contact us for information on the titles we publish, the industries we cover, and to receive media kits for the publications that you’re interested in.
